channel.title: Walking GLITCH ~HELP~
channel.description:
Ok heres is a video of my walking method in my server http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r_B6grlf80U
If anyone can please help me find a solution please post.
Also can this be caused by having a windows vps instead of linux vps?
P.S: Dont forget to tell me where to edit it =S
EDIT: Also heres some info of server 317 evolutionx source delta base

item.title: Walking GLITCH ~HELP~
item.dc:creator: @zepal222 zepal222
item.description:
@zepal222 wrote:

Grave digging, i dont care. i had the same problem, heres a fix for anyone else reading

1.Open up process.java (or processes.java) server sided.
2.Erase everything
3.Paste this in:

[code]public class Process extends Thread {
public static int cycleTime = 500;

@Override
public void run() {
	int waitFails = 0;
	long lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
	long totalTimeSpentProcessing = 0;
	int cycle = 0;
	while (!Server.shutdownServer) {
		try {
			if (Server.updateServer)
				Server.calcTime();
			Server.playerHandler.process();
			Server.npcHandler.process();
			Server.itemHandler.process();
			Server.shopHandler.process();
			long timeSpent = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastTicks;
			totalTimeSpentProcessing += timeSpent;
			if (timeSpent >= cycleTime) {
				timeSpent = cycleTime;
			}
			try {
				Thread.sleep(cycleTime - timeSpent);
			} catch (java.lang.Exception _ex) {
			}
			lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
			cycle++;
			if (cycle % 100 == 0) {
			float time = ((float) totalTimeSpentProcessing) / cycle;
			}
			if (Server.ShutDown == true) {
				if (Server.ShutDownCounter >= 100) {
					Server.shutdownServer = true;
				}
				Server.ShutDownCounter++;
			}
		} catch (Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

	// shut down the server
	EventManager.getSingleton().shutdown();
	Server.playerHandler.destruct();
	Server.clientHandler.killServer();
	Server.clientHandler = null;
}

} [/code]

Hope it helps anyone who had this problem

Read full topic

@wohuynia wrote:

Windows 2003 vps

Btw that vid is with 1 person online so i rlly dont think its the lagg[/quote]
well told you I’m using the same source where the walking codes are the same.
When i added several codes my server started to lag badly, i couldn’t turn the camera properly, when i redone the source( paste edited codes to the new source) that fixed the problem.

item.title: Walking GLITCH ~HELP~
item.dc:creator: @wohuynia wohuynia
item.description:
@wohuynia wrote:

It looks like it lags more and if you’re using delta, also as i and i don’t get bugs like these, then you shouldn’t to, unless you added something that jams the running method.
There are no other solutions, try to relocate old codes and see if they didn’t damage other codes or just try something to prevent lagging ;D
